assertions.text: In the chat screen, the user is able to delete the message for themselves only

evidence.description: User navigates into 'Me (You)' chat showing existing messages with timestamps at 4:27 PM and a deleted message from 'Yesterday' at 11:28 AM
Message 'Delete test message' appears in the chat at 4:27 PM with double checkmark indicating sent status
Context menu appears with options including Reply, Forward, Copy, Edit, Info, Star, and Delete (in red), plus More... option
Selection mode activated with circular checkboxes next to messages, 'Delete test message' selected with green checkmark, bottom bar shows '1 Selected' with trash icon
Modal dialog 'Delete message?' appears with two options: 'Delete for everyone' (red text) and 'Delete for me' (red text), with X close button
The 'Delete test message' is replaced with 'You deleted this message.' status at 4:27 PM, confirming message was deleted for user only

assertions.explanation: The recording clearly demonstrates the user deleting a message for themselves only. The sequence shows: (1) User opens the 'Me (You)' chat at t=3.7s, (2) Types 'Delete test message' at t=9.2-11.1s, (3) Sends the message which appears in the chat at t=11.1-12.9s, (4) Long-presses to access message options at t=16.6-18.5s showing a context menu with 'Delete' option, (5) Selects the message for deletion at t=20.3s showing '1 Selected' indicator, (6) Taps the delete icon at t=25.9-27.7s, (7) A dialog appears at t=27.7s offering 'Delete for everyone' and 'Delete for me' options, (8) After selection, the message is replaced with 'You deleted this message' status at t=33.3-35.1s. The presence of the 'Delete for me' option and the resulting 'You deleted this message' indicator confirms the message was deleted for the user only, not for all participants.
